meanings.definition: Give official permission for or approval to
meanings.sent1: The teacher will authorise the students to go on a field trip.
meanings.sent2: The manager will authorise the purchase of new equipment.
meanings.sent3: The principal decided to authorise an extra recess for the students.
meanings.sent4: The judge will authorise the release of the evidence in court.
meanings.sent5: The president authorises the use of military force in times of crisis.

meanings.sent1: The lawyer will authorise the client to sign the legal documents.
meanings.sent2: The government will authorise the police to make arrests.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape seemed to authorise him with special powers.
meanings.sent4: The crown will authorise the knight with the power to protect the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The magical amulet authorises its wearer with the ability to speak to animals.
